Reviews.Title: Why would you pay so much for an iPhone if you can have this phone?
Reviews.Author: XTIAN
Reviews.Content: My brother has an iPhone and as far as I can tell, my Optimus One can do the same things as his iPhone and even more because I can install apps from SD cards, use my phone as an emergency external storage device, share files through Bluetooth, install dashboard widgets, super customize it and more things an iPhone CAN'T do.I guess the iPhone can handle hi graphics games better (i'm just guessing, i haven't made a real comparison between them),but I don't believe that's the main function of a smartphone.WHAT I LIKE:- The display is very nice.- Touchscreen is responsive even with the LCD protectors.- Fast, responsive, smooth..- Even when it's made of plastic, it feels solid and elegant. It doesn't look cheap as other smartphones.- The buttons are of good quality BUT I think you only need 3 instead of 4. I've used some smartphones where the buttons get stucked.- Android Froyo 2.2.2 works great. I haven't upgraded it to 2.3 yet.- LG Messaging widget is very nice. I wish you could download it for other smartphones.- If you make a good management of apps/services you can make your battery last 3 days.- Charging time is very fast.WHAT I DON'T LIKE:- Camera has a delay when taking pictures.- The regular keyboard is somehow small that's why I use the widescreen keyboard but even there it happens lot of times that when pressing space I press full stop.- SD card slot should be more accessible (you have to take out the back cover) like in Samsung smartphones where you have a lateral slot.CONCLUSION : I believe it's an AWESOME smartphone for the price you pay. I haven't found anything I can't do that other smartphones can.

Reviews.Title: Nice Phone, BUT NO WARRANTY
Reviews.Author: XopShed
Reviews.Content: I really like this phone. It's got a big screen, feels good in my hand both for size and weight. The sound is good. The Wi-Fi and GPS work just fine. All in all, i'm very pleased with my purchase: a relatively inexpensive Android phone that has all the features I need .... except one. It's advertised as "Unlocked Phone - US Warranty" (LG P500 Optimus One with Android OS, Wi-Fi, GPS Navigation, Stereo Bluetooth, 3 MP Camera and Video Recorder - Unlocked Phone - US Warranty - Black). THERE IS NO US WARRANTY. I contacted LG directly (which is what the seller, L2D2Online, suggested after contacting them first). This phone is not marketed AT ALL in the US. The phones are "imported" from Mexico, and have a warranty in Mexico, which I can take advantage of at my own shipping expense. I specifically bought this phone - paying more money - because of the warranty (there's the same product at Amazon without warranty). You can buy a 3rd party warranty, for about $100 - 1/2 the price of the phone. That's what i assumed the seller was going to supply. The seller eventually gave me a small discount on the price, but i'd rather have the warranty. Just hope it doesn't break.

Reviews.Title: Very good phone, but not perfect
Reviews.Author: Gregory
Reviews.Content: I really can't understand why somebody want to spend 300-500$ on a iPhone or a Blackberry, when you can get this AWESOME LG Optimus One for much less than that and offering you almost the same functions and features than those "gimmick" phones. Snobbism? I don't know.I got my LG Optimus One used in near mint condition for about 150$, a VERY good price at the time for a smartphone (the guy who sold this to me was desperate for a Blackberry and wanted to get rid of it quick). I have a couple of months with this phone and my expectations surelly were exceeded. This is my first smartphone ever, though I have an iPoud Touch 3G with iOS 5 (which I don't use now) and almost everyone I know own different models of Blackberry, so I know how other smartphone work and what they have to offer... not much more than my "like new" LG.The LG Optimus One feels sturdy but I really don't think it will survive a medium-high drop, so I suggest beign careful with it. The 3.2inch screen is just THE SAME like than old iPhone/iTouch 3g (3.5inch), with beautiful and crisp colors, VERY responsive and bright, I couldn't tell any difference comparing it next to my Ipod Touch 3G, of course, this will not display 720p or Retina Display, but do I really want to watch a HD movie on the go? I prefer my big screen for that.It comes with Android 2.2 from factory, but you can upgrade it to 2.3 (Gingerbread) just downloading the update form the LG website. Android is just too awesome for words, I was a bit skeptic since I was used to iOS but I can say with property that Android is FAR BETTER than iOS, it feels less restrictive, more open and customizable and with cool exclusive features like widgets and animated wallpapers (at the moment of this writing). The Android Market (now called Google Play) has nothing to envy the Apple Store, there are thousand of apps to download, including FREE apps for Twitter, Facebook, Amazon and much, much more. My favorite: Equalizer, YES, a customizable equalizer for your music... an important feature missing on iOS (at least on iOS 5 and lower). With Android you are not restricted to one music player/video player/browser, nothing, you can download others and use your favorite, there are a lot of music player apps for Android including Songbird, Winamp and many others, most of them FREE. So definitively Android win here, I don't want to go back to iOS now.Not everything is perfect though:- You cannot upgrade to the latest versions of Android, the maximum compatible version is 2.3 Gingerbread, so no Android 4 Ice Cream Sandwich :(- The battery life is short, with moderate use (some calls and music player) it can last about 8-10h, so this phone needs to be charged every day.- Sometimes the phone struggles a little with the OS, for example it always freeze for a couple of seconds when I'm switching home-screens while listening to Winamp and with an animated wallpaper.- It struggles with a lot of games (i.e. Angry Birds), some others can't even be played.- No Flash for the camera.- No compatibility with Flash (for websites)Conclusion: if you don't care about 8000x5000 "retina" 5inch screens, 10000 MegaPixels cameras, restrictive OS, and you don't care about not playing the latest cutting-edge games, then this is the phone for you, you can do almost everything with this phone that you can do with the latest Blackberry: send and receive calls, emails, messages, send your tweets, take photos and share it with friends on Facebook, Whatsapp, browse the web and much much more, for less, less money.Features- 420MB RAM 600Mhz processor (good, but definitely not the best, some even say this phone can be overclocked, but I haven't tried it myself)- Nice design and build, not so heavy (130g)- Good Wifi/3G signal- Android 2.2 (upgrade-able to 2.3)- Excellent colorful crisp 480x320 3.2inch display- microSD slot for storing a lot of music/videos/files- PDF, Doc viewer- Awesome apps like Web browsers, Twitter, Facebook, calendar, notes, weather and thousands more to download from the market.- Standard 3.5mm jack for audio- Very good 3MP camera (no flash)- Can be used as a USB pendrive for storing files (in the microSD)- Can use YOUR FAVORITE digital music player for music/video synchronization (Mediamonkey, Winanp, Windows Media Player) NO longer restricted to that annoying iTunes!!! :D I feel relieved.Included in the package:- LG Optimus One P500 with protective screen film already applied.- USB cable for charging and file transfer.- Wall charger adapter.- Cheap earphones.- 2GB microSD card.- Instruction manual in English and Spanish.

Reviews.Title: for beginners
Reviews.Author: GG
Reviews.Content: If this is your first Android or your first smartphone I will recommend this one for sure. It has everything you need and is cheap.I will se just two problems: no flash for the camera and very little internal memory. But everything else is good.

Reviews.Title: FALSE DESCRIPTION!!! WCDMA BANDS = 900/2100
Reviews.Author: JohnMKeynes
Reviews.Content: Product description has this listed:WCDMA 850/1900/2100 Mhz frequenciesI was sent an Orange branded phone with WCDMA Band of 900/2100 which will not work with AT&T; 3G which was my intention(only edge data).Just wasted a week buying this false product. Will be returning.

Reviews.Title: Works on T-Mobile
Reviews.Author: j.gault "jgault"
Reviews.Content: Phone works ok but T-Mobile has had some trouble recognizing the phone when roaming. When we called TM to ask about the issue they said it was because it an out of market (US) set up.  Phone is good for its price

Reviews.Title: Very  Good Android Phone for an excellent Price
Reviews.Author: J. Barry Ryan
Reviews.Content: I bought this unlocked GSM phone to use while on vacation in Europe.  It is my first Android and i have been converted.  I will never go Apple again.  This is a relatively low cost phone with lots of great features.  It only has a rear camera and the density of the photos is only 3mb but think about what are are paying.  For 3x the price you can get a lot more but how important is the more.  This is a great phone value.  You cannot go wrong buying it.

Reviews.Title: What a mistake
Reviews.Author: steve c
Reviews.Content: This  was going to be a Christmas present for my wife. This was advertised as an "unlocked" phone, which means it will work with a carrier that supports the phone.  It wasnt defective, but still locked with "Virgin Mobile" which displayed when the phone turned on.  I spent alot of time and energy with T-Mobile (they support LG and this phone)  trying to get it to work and I had a great renew/upgrade already in the works with T-Mobile becasue I was using my own phone.  However, I could not get it to read the SIM card/s. Finally took it to the T-Mo store and they confirmed that it was not unlocked.  Although I got my money back, I still feel like I got ripped off.  I had to select a new service plan with my carrier and scramble to get a new phone right before christmas.  How hard is it to check out a phone before you send it to the customer??  One star for poor quality control.

Reviews.Title: Awesome unlocked phone
Reviews.Author: MH
Reviews.Content: I've bought this unlocked phone and its awesome! why buy a Iphone? I have it running on cm7 and getting really internet good speed with att and I'm really fine the 2g edge on the phone.

Reviews.Title: LG P500 Optimus One with Android OS, Wi-Fi, GPS Navigation, Stereo Bluetooth, 3 MP Camera and Video Recorder - Unlocked Phone -
Reviews.Author: Eduardo
Reviews.Content: Grateful to the seller, the teams arrived in perfect physical condition and performance. The Smartphone's are and do exactly as described and the waiting time for delivery was relatively short.Thank you very much very good salesman. I recommend it with confidence, it is also very good SmartphoneLG P500 Optimus One with Android OS, Wi-Fi, GPS Navigation, Stereo Bluetooth, 3 MP Camera and Video Recorder - Unlocked Phone - US Warranty - Black

Reviews.Title: Not compactible with T-mobile
Reviews.Author: Bridget Tokode
Reviews.Content: Its not compactible with T-Mobile. It may be good for other network but not good for T-Mobile despite the fact it was writing that its for T-Mobile.

Reviews.Title: Good phone for the price
Reviews.Author: NShindo
Reviews.Content: Good phone for the price, works well and does all that anyone needs as regular things that a cell phone does.

Reviews.Title: Good phone
Reviews.Author: Inese.
Reviews.Content: The phone works well; however, the SD card slot does not work. I tried several cards in there. I was very disappointed. Otherwise the phone take good pics and it is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: IExcellent for Android.
Reviews.Author: Jhon Alexander
Reviews.Content: This phone is for my brother, we long for something that suits your tastes, but eventually we found it, great phone, creaimos that would be smaller but it was great, in an incredible range, but not much camera focuses more on applications and games is to entertain. Would recommend to those who love to play and be always on social networks.

Reviews.Title: great phone for first smart phone user
Reviews.Author: aprilinmb
Reviews.Content: However, if you have used smart phones for a while you would find this phone difficult to text as the keypads are too small. I just switched from iPhone 3GS and felt LG Optimus P500 had difficult to maneuver whenever I need to type. I gave the phone to my boy friend who never had smart phone and he loves it.

Reviews.Title: NEED TO READ BEFORE PURCHASING
Reviews.Author: amir
Reviews.Content: I just bought this phone a couple days ago and recieved it a week later, really fast shipping! The touch screen is very annoying, you need to press really hard. And the keyboard gets on my nerves, it's alright but it's slow and small. Overall, this phone is nice byt it freezes sometimes, i'm already complaining and i had this phone for only 3 days lol.

Reviews.Title: No microSD included
Reviews.Author: amrish
Reviews.Content: Received this phone yesterday.A good phone for the price, but was disappointed to see that the 2GB microSD was not included in the package. This should have been a part of the standard package because even the basic/standard applications on the phone refuse to run without a microSD installed. I had to use my own from another phone just to get started with this one.

Reviews.Title: Overall, really like the phone. ONE THING THOUGH...
Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone back in May 2012. I love the look and feel of it. It is the perfect size, since I do not like the phones that have huge screens. I am not here to write a super detailed review. I just want it to be known that I think this is a great phone (especially for the price) and have no regrets about purchasing it. I did want to point out the one problem I have had with my phone. For some reason, my SD card doesn't stay put. So every so often my screen will go black (or sometimes flash black) and there is nothing you can do about it. It only stays (or flashes) black for like 10 seconds, then on the top of the phone it will say "SD card unexpectedly removed. Please insert a new one" I think the clasp that holds the SD card may be loose and that is why it does it. That is the only problem I have had with this phone so far. I would still recommend it to anyone looking for a new phone.

Reviews.Title: This is a Used phone.
Reviews.Author: Patrick Kramer
Reviews.Content: The packaging was damaged like someone opened it up in a hurry, the SD card was missing and the manufacturer sticker was put back on sloppily.When booting the phone up for the first time, Virgin Mobile was prominently displayed and the phone was bloatwared with their branded crappy apps; basically they just did a hard reset of the device before putting it back in the damaged packaging and pawned it off as *NEW*.Can't wait to put a SIM in it and see if this phone is actually unlocked, or if they sold me a bogus phone.

Reviews.Title: Great phone, dad product description
Reviews.Author: Edwin
Reviews.Content: This is a great phone, very good for people who are starting with android, but the product description said it works in 3G 850Mhz, but that information is false, It works on 3G 900Mhz. So be careful if you are looking for a specific 3G baseband.

Reviews.Title: Pay a little more and get a better phone
Reviews.Author: Maria
Reviews.Content: To be fair, the issue may have been that the phone is a few years old.  Regardless, I returned it after a week.  It took excessively long to download apps and many times wouldnt open them.  Internet was slow all around.  GPS could never find my location.

Reviews.Title: Quality Phone
Reviews.Author: William Owusu
Reviews.Content: I placed an order for this phone on 12/16/11 which was a Friday night. Yellow Deals the seller was closed for business on Saturday and Sunday. Phone was advertised for free shipping so I was expecting delivery on 12/28/11 by standard delivery. But suprisingly on Tuesday 12/20/11 afternoon it was delivered. Being the first time dealing with Yellow Deals I asked for s screen protector as a X'mas bonus and to my surprise they offered me a box of a Car Cradle with a Car Charger for use in my car, something other dealers charged extra for as the bonus(wow!! Very generious Isn't it?) The phone was brand new, came with everything as advertied, was truely unlocked(worked with Tmoble and AT&T;), and all the applications, loading and downloading including battery life are working O.K So far I will say that'a a best buy,I love it, had my money's worth and will certainly recommend and buy from Yellow Deals again, and again, and again!!! Thank you Yellow Deals.

Reviews.Title: good phone
Reviews.Author: Rigorist
Reviews.Content: this is a basic smartphone and works quite well at that. Internet connectivity, browsing, camera functioning are all good. However, navigation is poor. I haven't been able to use it yet. However, for the price its a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Ok
Reviews.Author: Jairo
Reviews.Content: Esto de tener que escribir los que piensa uno de un producto  cada vez que compra es muy aburridor, estos productos son demasiado sencillos para hacer comentarios
